Typedef Documentation

typedef int v4e_settings_func_t(void *ctx, char *name, char *fmt, int value, int def)

settings dump callback function definition

Parameters:
ctx - application provided context pointer;
name - name of encoder parameter;
fmt - format of encoder parameter ("%d", "%x");
value - integer value of parameter;
def - default parameter value;
Returns:
0=OK, other value=stop;

Definition at line 600 of file v4e_settings.h.

Function Documentation

int VSSHAPI v4_enc_get_pps ( void *  handle,
v4_spps_data_t *  pps_data 
)

Retrieve encoded Picture Parameter Set (PPS) NAL unit.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by vssh_enc_open);
pps_data - structure to be filled in with PPS bits;
Note:
"sps_data.data" pointer will be assigned to point to actual PPS bits;

"sps_data.size" will be assigned to a size of PPS in bytes;

Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4_enc_get_sps ( void *  handle,
v4_spps_data_t *  sps_data 
)

Retrieve encoded Sequence Parameter Set (SPS) NAL unit.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by vssh_enc_open);
sps_data - structure to be filled in with SPS information;
Note:
"sps_data.data" pointer will be assigned to point to actual SPS bits;

"sps_data.size" will be assigned to a size of SPS in bytes;

Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4_enc_get_svc_pps ( void *  handle,
v4_spps_data_t *  pps_data,
int  svc_layer_id 
)

Retrieve encoded Picture Parameter Set (PPS) NAL unit.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by vssh_enc_open);
pps_data - structure to be filled in with PPS bits;
svc_layer_id - id of svc layer
Note:
"sps_data.data" pointer will be assigned to point to actual PPS bits;

"sps_data.size" will be assigned to a size of PPS in bytes;

Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4_enc_get_svc_subsps ( void *  handle,

int  sei_id,
void *  sei_data,
int  sei_size,
unsigned int  sei_coding_flags 
)

Obsolete function.

Better to use v4e_attach_sei_to_list() instead Provided for backward compatibility

int VSSHAPI v4e_attach_sei_ex ( raw_frame_t *  raw_frame,
int  sei_id,
void *  sei_data,
int  sei_size,
unsigned int  sei_coding_flags,
int  stream_id 
)

int VSSHAPI v4e_attach_sei_to_list ( media_sample_t **  sei_list,
int  sei_id,
void *  sei_data,
int  sei_size,
unsigned int  sei_coding_flags,
int  stream_id 
)

Attach custom SEI data to sei list of the input frame before calling to "v4e_set_vp_frame()";.

Parameters:
sei_list pointer to SEI list. Usially the member vp_raw_frame_t structure
sei_id - SEI identifier,
See also:
"vssh_types.h"sei_type_e;
Parameters:
sei_data - pointer to appropriate data structure, could be freed just after the call;
sei_size - size of data structure, bytes;
sei_coding_flags - bitwise combination of sei coding flags,
See also:
"vssh_types.h"sei_coding_flags_e
Parameters:
stream_id - stream number in ParallelStream mode to attach SEI message to, should not exceeds number of parallel encoding streams
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_buf2settings ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
char *  buf,
int  len 
)

Parse given character string buffer into encoder settings.

Parameters:
settings - encoder settings structure to dump;
buf - character buffer to parse, expected format: "name=value\n"
len - length of character buffer, bytes;
Returns:
0=OK;
Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

int VSSHAPI v4e_change_bitrate ( void *  handle,
int  bitrate_kbps 
)

Change current bitrate value on-the-fly;.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
bitrate_kbps - new bitrate value;
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_change_bitrate_and_framerate ( void *  handle,
int  bitrate_kbps,
int  time_scale,
int  num_units_in_tick 
)

Change current bitrate and frame rate values on-the-fly;.

Note:
parameters can be zero. This mean that the function will not change this parameter;
Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
bitrate_kbps - new bitrate value;
time_scale - new time_scale value; frame_rate = time_scale/(2*num_units_in_tick);
num_units_in_tick - new num_units_in_tick value; See standard VUI parameters description for details
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_change_svc_bitrate_and_framerate ( void *  handle,
int  svc_layer_id,
int  bitrate_kbps,
int  time_scale,
int  num_units_in_tick 
)

Change bitrate and frame rate for paricular svc layer values on-the-fly;.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
svc_layer_id - layer id to work with, as listed in svc_settings;
bitrate_kbps - new bitrate value;
time_scale - new time_scale value; frame_rate = time_scale/(2*num_units_in_tick);
num_units_in_tick - new num_units_in_tick value; See standard VUI parameters description for details
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;
Note:
: parameters bitrate_kbps, time_scale, and num_units_in_tick can be zero. This mean that the function will not change this parameter;

int VSSHAPI v4e_check_settings ( v4e_settings_t *  settings  ) 

check and correct given encoder settings

Returns:
VSSH error code;
Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

int VSSHAPI v4e_close ( void *  handle  ) 

This function will impose flush event if not yet flushed to release output thread of application if it is waiting for NAL unit.

After that it will stop all the worker threads and free memory and system resources.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
Returns:
VSSH_OK;

int VSSHAPI v4e_default_settings ( v4e_settings_t *  settings  ) 

Provide default encoder settings into given structure.

Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

int VSSHAPI v4e_get_current_settings ( void *  handle,
v4e_settings_t *  settings 
)

Fill given settings structure with actual encoder settings;.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
settings - structure to fill
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_get_dual_pass_log ( void *  handle,
media_sample_t **  pms 
)

Retrieve results of first pass of dual-pass rate-control.

To be called after first pass encoding session, before call to "v4e_close()".

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
pms - allocated media sample with first pass log data;
Returns:
VSSH_OK = dual-pass log is available; VSSH_WARN_NOT_READY = data not ready;
Note:
caller must free media sample after use,
See also:
"media_sample.h::v4_free_media_sample()"

int VSSHAPI v4e_get_nal ( void *  handle,
media_sample_t **  pms 
)

The same as v4e_get_nal_ex(handle, pms, 0).

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
pms - pointer to a media sample with ready NAL unit;
Returns:
VSSH_OK = nal unit available; VSSH_WARN_NOT_READY = nal is not ready, but will be ready if wait VSSH_ERR_MORE_DATA = nal is not ready and will not be ready if wait (more frames needed) VSSH_WARN_EOS = end of stream;

int VSSHAPI v4e_get_nal_ex ( void *  handle,
media_sample_t **  pms,
int  blocking 
)

Retrieve next available encoded nal unit (synchronous, non-blocking).

This function is used only if receive nal callback function is not set

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
pms - pointer to a media sample with ready NAL unit;
blocking - flag to wait for NAL if it should be ready (0 - don't wait)
Returns:
VSSH_OK = nal unit available; VSSH_WARN_NOT_READY = nal is not ready, but will be ready if wait VSSH_ERR_MORE_DATA = nal is not ready and will not be ready if wait (more frames needed) VSSH_WARN_EOS = end of stream;
Note:
caller must free media sample after use,
See also:
"media_sample.h::v4_free_media_sample()"

int VSSHAPI v4e_getparambyname ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
char *  name,
int  namelen,
int *  value 
)

Get encoder parameter by name.

Parameters:
settings - encoder settings structure;
name - name of parameter (for ex. "rc.kbps")
namelen - length of parameter name
value - pointer to return current parameter value
Returns:
0=OK;

int VSSHAPI v4e_open ( void **  phandle,
v4e_settings_t *  settings 
)

Create a new encoder instance.

Parameters:
phandle - pointer to a variable which will receive encoder handle in case of success, can not be NULL;
settings - pointer to the v4e_settings_t structure containing initial encoder parameters to be used during this encoding session, can not be NULL.
Note:
framerate should be assigned via "gop_settings" member;
Returns:
VSSH_OK = success, VSSH_ERR_ARG = invalid arg (NULL), VSSH_ERR_SETTINGS = incorrect settings, VSSH_ERR_MEMORY = out of memory; VSSH_WARN_LEVEL_LIMITS = settings do not fit into profile/level limitations;

int VSSHAPI v4e_open_ex ( void **  phandle,
v4e_settings_t *  settings,
v4_frame_release_t *  frame_release,
v4_receive_nal_t *  receive_nal 
)

Extended version of v4e_open() Create a new encoder instance.

Parameters:
phandle - pointer to a variable which will receive encoder handle in case of success, can not be NULL;
settings - pointer to the v4e_settings_t structure containing initial encoder parameters to be used during this encoding session, can not be NULL.
frame_release - describes release callback function, can be NULL;
receive_nal - describes receive nal callback function, can be NULL;
Returns:
VSSH_OK = success, VSSH_ERR_ARG = invalid arg (NULL), VSSH_ERR_SETTINGS = incorrect settings, VSSH_ERR_MEMORY = out of memory; VSSH_WARN_LEVEL_LIMITS = settings do not fit into profile/level limitations;
Note:
framerate should be assigned via "gop_settings" member;

int VSSHAPI v4e_read_cmd_line ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
char *  argv[] 
)

Load encoder settings from a command line arguments Every argument expected to be in the NAME=VALUE form; Parameters found in arguments list will be changed in "settings" structure;.

Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

int VSSHAPI v4e_read_config_file ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
char *  filename 
)

Load given configuration text file.

Returns:
0=OK, -1=the file could not be opened for read;
Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

that function loads only first 1023 lines of text and length of line must be less then 1023 characters

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_current_loss_percents ( void *  handle,
int  new_expected_loss_percents 
)

Resets on-the-fly the encoder error resillience settings according to the new value of the expected loss rate.

Parameters:
handle - Handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_enc_open)
new_expected_loss_percents - new value of the expected losses (%, [0..100])
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_dual_pass_log ( void *  handle,
media_sample_t *  pms 
)

Provide encoder with first pass results of dual-pass rate-control.

To be called before second pass encoding session.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
pms - allocated media sample with first pass log data;
Returns:
VSSH_OK = all OK; VSSH_WARN_NOT_READY = wrong data;
Note:
  • use library function for media sample allocation,
See also:
"media_sample.h::v4_alloc_media_sample()";
  • caller shall properly assign "pms->used_size";
  • put first pass data into "pms->data" buffer;

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_flush ( void *  handle  ) 

This function signals encoder to process all the pending frames and return all NAL units and EOS flag at the very end.

Anyway the encoder is still running and could be used again without stop / start operation.

Note:
EOS state will be reset after next v4e_set_frame() call.
Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_frame ( void *  handle,
raw_frame_t *  raw_frame 
)

Obsolete functions.

Better to use v4e_set_vp_frame() instead Provided for backward compatibility

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_frame_ex ( void *  handle,
raw_frame_t *  raw_frame,
int  blocking 
)

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_scaling_matrix ( void *  handle,
int  matrix_type,
byte *  scaling_matrix 
)

Set custom scaling matrix for specified matrix type Valid only if frext.scaling_matrix parameter is enabled in encoder settings Must be called before any call to v4e_set_frame(),v4e_get_sps() and v4e_get_pps() functions.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
matrix_type - scaling matix type
See also:
"vssh_types.h"scaling_matrix_type_e;
Parameters:
scaling_matrix - Coefficients of the custom scaling matrix in progressive scan order. There must be 16 values for types 0-5 and 64 values for types 6-7
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_vp_frame ( void *  handle,
vp_raw_frame_t *  vp_raw_frame,
int  blocking 
)

The function sends given frame to encoder and immediately returns.

If blocking is not allowed and there are no more free input slots, this function returns appropriate error code, otherwise it will wait for a next free encoder input slot. Caller must provide â€œframe release callbackâ€ function in "v4e_open_ex()" call to receive â€œreleaseâ€ events signaling that particular frame is no more used and thus could be reused or freed by application. It is the caller responsibility to guarantee that frames do not be reused before release event.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
vp_raw_frame - uncompressed frame data, NULL is not allowed;
blocking - enable blocking [0/1];
Returns:
VSSH_OK = succeeded; VSSH_WARN_NOT_READY = no free data slot available (if blocking disabled);

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_vp_frame_and_mbs_data ( void *  handle,
vp_raw_frame_t *  vp_raw_frame,
media_sample_t *  mbs_data,
int  blocking 
)

The function sends given frame and its macrobock data to encoder.

Intended to be used in transcoding applications. Macroblock data must me received in decoder by v4d_get_frame_macroblocks_data() function Encoder will release this sample, when done with it Other parameters are used as in v4e_set_vp_frame() function

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
vp_raw_frame - uncompressed frame data, NULL is not allowed;
mbs_data - media sample with macroblocks data
blocking - enable blocking [0/1];
Returns:
VSSH_OK = succeeded; otherwise error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_set_vui_parameters ( void *  handle,
vssh_vui_seq_parameters_t *  vui 
)

Set vui parameters Note, that only parameters which donâ€™t contradict with encoder settings are actually set.

Such parameters as â€˜time_scaleâ€™, â€˜num_units_in_tickâ€™, hrd-buffer related parameters are calculated from encoder settings and remain unchanged.

Parameters:
handle - handle of the encoder instance (returned by v4e_open());
vui - vui parameters;
Returns:
VSSH_OK or error code;

int VSSHAPI v4e_setparambyname ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
char *  name,
int  namelen,
int  value 
)

Set encoder parameter by name.

Parameters:

namelen - length of parameter name
value - new parameter value
Returns:
0=OK;

char *  buf,
int  len 
)

Dump given encoder settings into character string buffer.

Returns:
0=OK;
Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

int VSSHAPI v4e_settings2buf_ex ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
void *  ctx,
v4e_settings_func_t  func 
)

Dump given encoder settings via callback function.

Parameters:
settings - encoder settings structure to dump;
ctx - application context to pass to callback function;
func - callback function to call on each encoder parameter;
Returns:
0=OK;
Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned

int VSSHAPI v4e_write_config_file ( v4e_settings_t *  settings,
char *  filename 
)

Print given settings to a file.

Parameters:
settings - pointer to a structure to fill in;
filename - name of the file to write to, pass NULL to print to stdout;
Returns:
0=OK
Note:
"settings->size" should be assigned
